LanguageData.ZMD_generalTabInfo: Get started with a preset, or explore detailed options are available on the other tabs.\n\nAll settings are relative to your base map. A barren rainforest will have more plants than a fertile valley desert; flat maps will always have less hills than mountainous maps with the same settings.
LanguageData.ZMD_presetFertileValleyDesc: A secluded valley surrounded by mountains. Higher fertility, more plants, and fewer ruins.
LanguageData.ZMD_presetBarrensDesc: A relatively desolate landscape with small, spiky hills. Lower fertility and less plants than normal. Extra steam geysers.
LanguageData.ZMD_presetUnnaturalDesc: Strange, unnatural mountains littered with ancient dangers.
LanguageData.ZMD_presetFishingVillageDesc: Large hills to dig into, but little solid ground otherwise. Swamps may have NO solid ground outside of the mountains!
LanguageData.ZMD_presetCanyonDesc: A narrow canyon with several types of rock. If your tile has a river, the river will follow the canyon.
LanguageData.ZMD_presetZyllesChoiceDesc: I like these settings. Lots of chokepoints and half-closed valleys, with slightly increased fertile soil.
LanguageData.ZMD_presetRandomDesc: This will randomize settings every time you click "apply". Results may be unpredictable.
LanguageData.ZMD_flagPopupDesc: You can access these settings any time from Menu -> Options -> Mod Settings -> Map Designer
LanguageData.ZMD_flagHomeMapOnly: Limit settings to your home map
LanguageData.ZMD_flagHomeMapOnlyDesc: Currently applies to: Mountains\n\nIf checked, these things will be vanilla on quest maps, ai faction bases, and other non-home maps.
LanguageData.ZMD_saveFail1: A config with this name is already saved, delete it first.
LanguageData.ZMD_saveFail2: Your config must have a name.
LanguageData.ZMD_saveFail3: You have too many saved configs, delete some to make room.
LanguageData.ZMD_hillAmountTooltip: How mountainous your map will be
LanguageData.ZMD_hillSizeTooltip: Size of individual hills. Big hills for maps with 1-2 big mountains, small hills for jagged landscapes with lots of corners.
LanguageData.ZMD_hillSize3: Tiny. Underground bases may not be possible
LanguageData.ZMD_hillSize4: Very tiny. Each hill may only be a few tiles.
LanguageData.ZMD_hillArrangementDesc: How hills are positioned on your map. Create customized valleys and mountains. Disable all = vanilla
LanguageData.ZMD_flagHillClumpingTooltip: For small hills. Will make hills vary naturally instead of being evenly distributed.
LanguageData.ZMD_flagHillRadialTooltip: Push the mountains to the edges of your map for a valley, or pull them to the center and build in a solid mountain.
LanguageData.ZMD_hillRadialAmtTooltip: How much difference there is between the center and edges of the map
LanguageData.ZMD_hillRadialSizeTooltip: Push hills just out of the center, or all the way to the edges
LanguageData.ZMD_hillRadialSize4: To the edge of the map
LanguageData.ZMD_flagCavesTooltip: Unchecking this prevents caves from ever spawning, even on tiles with mountains or large hills.
LanguageData.ZMD_flagMtnExitTooltip: For very mountainous maps. Guarantees a clear path to the center of the map.
LanguageData.ZMD_thingsMissing: Missing a mod that adds map stuff? Let me know on Steam or Discord!
LanguageData.ZMD_densityDangerTooltip: NOTE: Ancient dangers will not spawn on completely flat maps
LanguageData.ZMD_flagRockChunksTooltip: If disabled, new maps will have NO chunks.
LanguageData.ZMD_flagCaveDebrisTooltip: Ancient beds, sometimes with old uniforms or scattered documents
LanguageData.ZMD_flagAncientUtilityBuildingTooltip: Ancient power stations, sometimes including fences or buildings
LanguageData.ZMD_riverStyleSpringDesc: Rivers starts near the middle of the map and continues to the edge
LanguageData.ZMD_riverStyleOxbowDesc: A winding river with big, smooth loops
LanguageData.ZMD_riverStyleIslandDesc: A river that splits to make an island, then joins back into one on the other side
LanguageData.ZMD_riverLocRelDesc: Location is relative to the vanilla position
LanguageData.ZMD_riverLocAbsDesc: Exactly where you put it, no randomness
LanguageData.ZMD_featureTabInfo: Add a special feature to only your home map. These will not spawn on other maps, like quest maps.
LanguageData.ZMD_featurePRIInfo: Your map is one or more perfectly round islands, surrounded by shallow water. Trade caravans, raids and wild animals will still enter normally from the sides.
LanguageData.ZMD_featureLakeInfo: A natural lake.\nMountains can spawn inside the lake by default. You can use the "Central hill distribution" option on the Mountains tab to prevent this, or to create a mountain island in the center.
LanguageData.ZMD_featureNiInfo: A natural island, surrounded by a mix of shallow and deep water. Trade caravans, raids and wild animals will still enter normally from the sides, and will path over any passable water.
LanguageData.ZMD_priMultiDesc: Multiple randomly placed islands, biggest in the middle.
LanguageData.ZMD_niWaterDepthWarning: WARNING: Too much deep water can create unpathable islands!
LanguageData.ZMD_terrainTabInfo: Fertility, water levels, and rock types.\n\nTurning up water levels will increase size and number of marshes and lakes, but will NOT add new lakes to biomes that don't otherwise have them.
LanguageData.ZMD_flagBiomeRocks: Allow modded biomes with special rocks, like Atolls or the Ocular Forest, to have other rock types.
LanguageData.ZMD_flagBiomeRocksTooltip: This can drastically change game balance in some modded biomes. Removing special rocks might remove needed resources.
LanguageData.ZMD_noRockWarning: No rocks are allowed! Please enable at least one type.\nIf you leave all types disabled, maps will spawn with random rock types.
LanguageData.ZMD_noColorFound: No color found for this rock!
LanguageData.ZMD_terrainWaterTooltip: Size and number of lakes etc. Does not affect rivers, coastlines, or other features.
LanguageData.ZMD_flagTerrainWater: All non-buildable terrain counts as water
LanguageData.ZMD_flagTerrainWaterTooltip: All terrains without heavy affordance count as water. Includes mud, marsh, soft sand
LanguageData.ZMD_betaTabInfo: WARNING! These options are for development. They might be mislabeled, might do nothing, and will probably spam the error log.\n\n If there are issues, please report with the error log. If these work, please report that also.
